channel.title: Android smartphones
channel.description: What should I get? (Android) Some that intrest me would be the HTC sensation, Samsung Galaxy s2, Motorola RAZR. I don't know what to get..?

item.title: Android smartphones
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:21, topic:432978”]As far as I am concerned, internets is internets and you don’t need fancy speeds. I never run mine above 56kbps.

As far as I am concerned, vision is vision and you don’t need fancy colours. I never run mine beyond black and white.[/quote]

Now that is just silly, you can’t watch porn at 56kbps.

item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

HcoJustin:

If you want ICS anytime soon stay away from Motorola… I’ll be lucky to see an official build from Moto by the end of August. Hopefully the CM9 port becomes more useable by then.

Yeah I got the shit end of the stick with my MoPho on Sprint. Ended up rooting, unlocking, and putting CM9 on it.

item.title: Android smartphones
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:12, topic:432978”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=535698.msg3917593#msg3917593 date=1329354563]

[quote author=eczema3 link=topic=535698.msg3917567#msg3917567 date=1329353735]

HTC sensation getting the ICS update in march, might get that or the Sensation XE like SilentCJ said. They are both getting the update as far as I’m concerned.

Do this:

I’d recommend you to get an Anker battery and flash an ICS rom on it, it’ll have much better battery time!

Big improvement. I’ve had ICS for around 2 months now too, plenty of ICS roms you can use on XDA, I can quite easily get 2 days out of it with moderate use.

Oh and if you’re getting it unlocked and paying the full price, it’s probably not worth getting the XE version as it has the same hardware (excluding the battery), and the headphones are all hype tbh. Don’t get me wrong they’re good, but I’m an audiophile and there’s not a huge amount of difference from my £10 skullcandy ink’d headphones.
[/quote]> Audiophile

Skullcandy

I hope ur not srs

I have several different headphones, they’re my casual ‘outdoor’ backup headphones, don’t wanna lug round a pair of overheads when I’m out and about, I only bust out the sennheiser’s when I’m at home

If you even own a pair of skullcandy headphones, you cannot call yourself an audiophile.

… it was a present?
Nah I’m kidding but really, whatever, off topic. :o
[/quote]I wear sennheisers when i am out, when inside i use: http://www.amazon.com/Denon-AH-D7000-Reference-Over-Ear-Headphones/dp/B001EO9TM6[/quote]
wat
watwatwatwat
the best headphones ive ever used were a $50 pair from sony
http://www.amazon.com/Sony-MDR-XB300-Extra-Bass-Headphones/dp/B001RB24R8
or this off brand one with active “noise canceling” i got from abc warehouse for $25

Read full topic

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:9, topic:432978”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=535698.msg3917076#msg3917076 date=1329312800]

HTC sensation getting the ICS update in march, might get that or the Sensation XE like SilentCJ said. They are both getting the update as far as I’m concerned.

Do this:

I’d recommend you to get an Anker battery and flash an ICS rom on it, it’ll have much better battery time!

Big improvement. I’ve had ICS for around 2 months now too, plenty of ICS roms you can use on XDA, I can quite easily get 2 days out of it with moderate use.

Oh and if you’re getting it unlocked and paying the full price, it’s probably not worth getting the XE version as it has the same hardware (excluding the battery), and the headphones are all hype tbh. Don’t get me wrong they’re good, but I’m an audiophile and there’s not a huge amount of difference from my £10 skullcandy ink’d headphones.
[/quote]> Audiophile

I hope ur not srs

If you even own a pair of skullcandy headphones, you cannot call yourself an audiophile.

item.title: Android smartphones
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:8, topic:432978”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=535698.msg3917039#msg3917039 date=1329307833]

HTC sensation getting the ICS update in march, might get that or the Sensation XE like SilentCJ said. They are both getting the update as far as I’m concerned.

Do this:

I’d recommend you to get an Anker battery and flash an ICS rom on it, it’ll have much better battery time!

Big improvement. I’ve had ICS for around 2 months now too, plenty of ICS roms you can use on XDA, I can quite easily get 2 days out of it with moderate use.

Oh and if you’re getting it unlocked and paying the full price, it’s probably not worth getting the XE version as it has the same hardware (excluding the battery), and the headphones are all hype tbh. Don’t get me wrong they’re good, but I’m an audiophile and there’s not a huge amount of difference from my £10 skullcandy ink’d headphones.
[/quote]> Audiophile

Skullcandy

I hope ur not srs[/quote]
I have several different headphones, they’re my casual ‘outdoor’ backup headphones, don’t wanna lug round a pair of overheads when I’m out and about, I only bust out the sennheiser’s when I’m at home

item.title: Android smartphones
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:7, topic:432978”][quote author=StubernSnake link=topic=535698.msg3916680#msg3916680 date=1329266866]
HTC sensation getting the ICS update in march, might get that or the Sensation XE like SilentCJ said. They are both getting the update as far as I’m concerned.
[/quote]
Do this:

I’d recommend you to get an Anker battery and flash an ICS rom on it, it’ll have much better battery time!

Big improvement. I’ve had ICS for around 2 months now too, plenty of ICS roms you can use on XDA, I can quite easily get 2 days out of it with moderate use.

Oh and if you’re getting it unlocked and paying the full price, it’s probably not worth getting the XE version as it has the same hardware (excluding the battery), and the headphones are all hype tbh. Don’t get me wrong they’re good, but I’m an audiophile and there’s not a huge amount of difference from my £10 skullcandy ink’d headphones.[/quote]> Audiophile

Skullcandy

I hope ur not srs

item.title: Android smartphones
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

StubernSnake:

HTC sensation getting the ICS update in march, might get that or the Sensation XE like SilentCJ said. They are both getting the update as far as I’m concerned.

Do this:

sppt:

I’d recommend you to get an Anker battery and flash an ICS rom on it, it’ll have much better battery time!

Big improvement. I’ve had ICS for around 2 months now too, plenty of ICS roms you can use on XDA, I can quite easily get 2 days out of it with moderate use.

Oh and if you’re getting it unlocked and paying the full price, it’s probably not worth getting the XE version as it has the same hardware (excluding the battery), and the headphones are all hype tbh, it’s merely a sound EQ. Don’t get me wrong they’re good, but I’m an audiophile and there’s not a huge amount of difference from my £10 skullcandy ink’d headphones.

Read full topic

item.title: Android smartphones
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Moparisthebest:

If you don’t mind it being HUGE get the Motorola RAZR, it’s very flat but to make up for it it’s tall and wide.

All 3 of the phones mentioned have the same size 4.3" screen

I have the Sensation XE and it’s brilliant, couldn’t want any more in a phone.
Decided not to go for the Galaxy S2 because it just looked cheap imo.

Read full topic
